intro: Melochia cephalodes, commonly known as the hairy melochia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with hairy surfaces and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber in some regions.
